intro: Scrophularia californica, commonly known as California figwort, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It features erect stems that can grow up to 2 feet tall, covered with fine, hairy pubescence. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of pink to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly wrinkled texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks.
